title: Relates to the entry into premises by the agent of a utility or municipality; repealer
summary: Establishes an agent of a utility or municipality may not enter premises without permission of a person lawfully in control of the premises; establishes certain exceptions.

                                         1576

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. TEDISCO, SAYWARD -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of
         A. CROUCH, FINCH -- read once and referred to the Committee on  Corpo-
         rations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN  ACT  to  amend the public service law, in relation to the inspection
         and examination of apparatus by the agent of a utility or municipality
         and to repeal section 47 of such law relating thereto

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 47 of the public service law is REPEALED and a new
    2  section 47 is added to read as follows:
    3    S 47. INSPECTION AND EXAMINATION OF APPARATUS. 1. EXCEPT WHEN AN EMER-
    4  GENCY MAY THREATEN THE HEALTH OR SAFETY OF  A  PERSON,  THE  SURROUNDING
    5  AREA  OR  THE  UTILITY'S  OR MUNICIPALITY'S DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM OR WHERE
    6  AUTHORIZED BY COURT ORDER, AN AGENT OF A UTILITY OR MUNICIPALITY, OTHER-
    7  WISE DULY AUTHORIZED TO INSPECT AND  EXAMINE  APPARATUS  MAY  NOT  ENTER
    8  PREMISES,  REGARDLESS  OF  WHETHER SUCH PREMISES ARE LOCKED OR UNLOCKED,
    9  WITHOUT PERMISSION OF A PERSON LAWFULLY IN CONTROL OF THE PREMISES,  NOR
   10  USE ANY MANNER OF FORCE TO CARRY OUT SUCH INSPECTION AND EXAMINATION.
   11    2.  NOTWITHSTANDING SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION, A DULY AUTHORIZED
   12  AGENT OF A UTILITY CORPORATION OR MUNICIPALITY MAY ENTER THE COMMON AREA
   13  OF A MULTIPLE DWELLING SUPPLIED WITH GAS OR ELECTRICITY BY  THE  UTILITY
   14  CORPORATION OR MUNICIPALITY, FOR THE PURPOSE OF INSPECTING AND EXAMINING
   15  THE  METERS,  PIPES, FITTINGS, WIRES AND OTHER APPARATUS FOR REGULATING,
   16  SUPPLYING AND/OR ASCERTAINING THE QUANTITY SUPPLIED, UNDER THE FOLLOWING
   17  TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
   18    (A) THE AGENT EXHIBITS A  PHOTO-IDENTIFICATION  BADGE  AND  A  WRITTEN
   19  AUTHORITY  SIGNED  BY  THE  PRESIDENT OR VICE-PRESIDENT AND SECRETARY OR
   20  ASSISTANT SECRETARY OF THE CORPORATION, OR BY THE MAYOR OR  CLERK  OF  A
   21  MUNICIPAL CORPORATION OR BY THE CHAIRPERSON AND SECRETARY OF A MUNICIPAL
   22  BOARD IN CONTROL OF A MUNICIPAL UTILITY, AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02222-01-1

       A. 1576                             2

    1    (B)  ANY  SUCH  INSPECTION  AND  EXAMINATION  SHALL  BE CONDUCTED ON A
    2  NON-HOLIDAY WORK DAY BETWEEN EIGHT A.M.  AND  SIX  P.M.  OR  SUCH  OTHER
    3  REASONABLE  TIME REQUESTED BY THE CUSTOMER, EXCEPT WHEN AN EMERGENCY MAY
    4  THREATEN THE HEALTH OR SAFETY OF A PERSON, THE SURROUNDING AREA  OR  THE
    5  UTILITY'S  OR  MUNICIPALITY'S  DISTRIBUTION  SYSTEM,  OR EXCEPT WHEN THE
    6  COMMISSION BY REGULATION ESTABLISHES A DIFFERENT TIME FOR THE INSPECTION
    7  AND EXAMINATION WHERE THERE IS EVIDENCE OF METER TAMPERING OR  THEFT  OF
    8  SERVICES.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to the inspection and examination of apparatus by the agent of a utility or municipality and to repeal section 47 of such law relating thereto
